sn29.3:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn29.3:1.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn29.3:1.3: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why some egg-born dragons keep the sabbath, having transformed their bodies?”
sn29.3:2.1: “Mendicant, it’s when some egg-born dragons think:
sn29.3:2.2: ‘In the past we did both kinds of deeds by body, speech, and mind.
sn29.3:2.3: When the body broke up, after death, we were reborn in the company of the egg-born dragons.
sn29.3:2.4: If today we do good things by body, speech, and mind, when the body breaks up, after death, we may be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
sn29.3:2.5: Come, let us do good things by way of body, speech, and mind.’
sn29.3:2.6: This is the cause, this is the reason why some egg-born dragons keep the sabbath, having transformed their bodies.”
